description.h2: If xsd:element type attribute equals or is derived from 'domainItemType' in a standard taxonomy schema target namespace then the xbrli:periodType attribute must equal 'duration'.
description.p: REMARK: this only applies to company extension schemas, although it holds for all standard taxonomies. If there were a standard taxonomy that violated the rule, it would appear in a 'good' test variation.

variation.name: 6.7.28, Element is e60728:domainItemType (type not in a standard namespace) but instant, GOOD.
variation.description: Element is e60728:domainItemType (type not in a standard namespace) but instant, GOOD.

variation.name: 6.7.28, Element is us-types:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Element is us-types:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.7.28, Element is nonnum:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Element is nonnum:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.7.28, Element type is derived from nonnum:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Element type is derived from nonnum:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.7.28, Element type is derived from us-types:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.
variation.description: Element type is derived from us-types:domainItemType but instant, NOGOOD.
